basics.name: Levi Sheridan
basics.label: Mechanical Engineer
basics.summary: Mechanical engineer specializing in hardware development, robotics, and manufacturing optimization. 13 years of 3D printing experience with expertise spanning CAD, prototyping, PCB design, and design for production.

work.name: Lever Labs
highlights: Designed battery-powered electronics system for educational robot: 4-layer main PCB with ESP32, power management (Li-ion charging, buck/boost converters), sensor integration (IMU, ToF, color sensor, encoders), and three flex peripheral boards

Solved critical hardware issues through 5 board revisions including I2C stability, ESP32 brownout during motor switching, and DFM optimization. Drove per-unit cost from $200+ to $69 and assembly time from 45 minutes to 4 minutes
Worked directly with contract manufacturer in China on electronics production. Piloted with 25 students, accumulating hundreds of hours of real-world testing and validation

work.name: SpaceX

Designed and manufactured production tooling using Siemens NX and lean methodology, improving throughput and technician efficiency across foundry operations
Operated and maintained Stratasys and 3D Systems industrial SLA printers to aid prototyping and production requirements
Received full-time return offer upon completion of internship
